name: Metrics
description: Metrics is the podcast’s through-line for turning strategy into measurable progress: choosing what to measure, how to measure it credibly, and how to use measurement to make better product, growth, and org decisions. Across episodes, guests emphasize that good metrics systems prevent local optimization (e.g., short-term conversion at the expense of retention or trust), create fast learning loops via experimentation/evals, and align teams on outcomes rather than activity.
subtopics: North Star metrics and metric hierarchies: connecting mission/strategy to leading indicators and team-level scorecards
Experimentation and causal measurement: designing tests, avoiding false positives, and building an operating cadence for rapid learning
Input vs output metrics: when to manage controllable inputs (quality, speed, reliability) vs lagging business outcomes (revenue, retention)
Attribution and measurement under uncertainty: privacy-driven shifts from deterministic attribution to probabilistic decision-making and triangulation
Retention, activation, and onboarding measurement: aligning brand promise to product experience and measuring time-to-value and cohort health
Long-term vs short-term optimization: measuring durable value (LTV, trust, quality) and avoiding metric gaming or churn myopia
common_frameworks: North Star Metric + input/driver metrics (metric trees / hierarchies)
Amazon “Working Backwards” with input vs output metrics and mechanism-based management
Experimentation operating system (hypothesis → test design → analysis → rollout/holdout → iteration cadence)
Cohort-based retention/activation analysis (time-to-value, funnel + retention curves)
OKRs as a measurement and learning cadence (quarterly goals, grading, retrospectives)
Evals for AI systems (task suites, reliability/quality scoring, regression testing as product requirements)
